body:
Hello,
Thanks for your help.
Your changes were committed to Apache Ignite repository (git://git.apache.org/incubator-ignite.git).

Raul,

please read the "Development process" page (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/Development+Process)?
It contains usefull information about code style, contribution process, etc.

It would be great if you format code accordingly to our style guides and attach patch to JIRA ticket.

BTW, we don't use JUnit 4.
Looks good, but I think for all the additive values we need to use LongAdder8 instead of Atomics.
Need to perform additional refactoring and after that will create one more pull-request

Ken, my comments are below:
- I do not think that we need to ever return system cache names to a user. System caches may be a subject to change without notice, and a reference to a system cache can be never obtained by a user. This method should always return only user caches.
- I think the return type may be weaken to Collection<String>
- You do not need to create an instance of VisorCacheMetrics to determine is this is a user cache. The correct if statement should be `if (ca.context().started() && ca.context().userCache())`

Ken, please add the following test: start 3 server nodes and a client node, start a cache on a server node and then call cacheNames() on the client node. It should fail in the current implementation as cacheContext is not created on the client node unless the cache is accessed.

Ken,

You fixed this only for the quiet mode. There are similar messages if you run node in a verbose mode (./ignite.sh -v), they should contain grid name as well. Please fix this.

Hi agoncharuk,
yes, just as you said, if the node start with client mode 

```
 cfg.setClientMode(true);
```

Then the case will fail, I have implemented the method as you advised.
please help to reivew
Changes was made without this PR in ignite-1.4 branch.
@anton-vinogradov  refactor code according to Ignite Coding Guidelines
This request is closed, We're waiting for a  pull request by Chandresh, assigner of the ticket.

Thanks for your pull request,
It was merged to master.
[Ignite-429] Implement IgniteStormStreamer to stream data from Apache Storm #130
Merged to main Apache Ignite development branch.

Val,

There is a javadoc entry for the missing readers variable in clearLocally(K) in IgniteInternalCache. Is it just javadoc or a really missed argument for the function? 

Otherwise looks good.
Merged to the main development branch.
Note: this PRQ includes changes of IGNITE-1743 also.
Changes look good. Merged to the master.
The branch is out dated. Up to date implementation at another branch. Will open new PR.

Ken, thanks for the contribution!

Reviewed, did minor changes & merge to 1.5 and master branch.

Ken, thanks for the contribution!

Reviewed, did minor changes & merge to 1.5 and master branch.

Thanks for the contribution!

Reviewed, did minor changes & merge to 1.5 and master branch.

Hi,

Thanks for trying to address the issue. However your fix is not valid. Please refer to for more details
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-2135

Hi,

I have updated the PR with review feedback.

Regards
Saikat

Hi Saikat, thanks!

I'm on holidays and will be able to review your changes at the end of the
next week.

Denis

This commit has now been updated to protect correctly against the race condition.
Close because of old target branch

Hi,

Please follow Ignite contribution process fully.
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/How+to+Contribute#HowtoContribute-1.CreateGitHubpull-request

In short, once you're sure that nothing is broken by your contribution, move the ticket into patch available state and ask the community for review on the dev list.

Regards,
Denis
Closing because of incorrect target branch
IGNITE-2555 Logging non heap memory usage and node uptime
Added test, that check logging correctness and node liveness. Included test in IgniteBasicTestSuite.

@dmagda 

Hey Denis,

Can you please review this change for validation of non existing lines.

Regards
Saikat

@dmagda 

Thank you Denis. I have updated the files as per review comments.

Regards
Saikat
Ok - fixed included as per Val's suggestions.

@dmagda 

Can you please review and share feedback.

Regards
Saikat
It had been merging through cherry-pick .
It had been merging through cherry-pick .

I do not like this fix.
You are using MySql specific back tick escaping syntax that will fail on all other RDBMs.
I think proper fix is to rename key to something else, for example: akey, lead, item....
I agree that it will be hard to find a good synonym for "key". :)

After some more thinking of this fix, I came to decision that we do not need to change anything at all.
Thouse DFLT_ constants just a some defaults and it is impossible to have defaults that will fit all RDBMs. User can easily fix issue with "key" for MySQL by specifying appropriate SQL statement in CacheJdbcBlobStore via setCreateTableQuery() method.
Let's close this PR as "Won't fix"? Thoughts?

In its current state any mysql user is going to have the same troubles as I did and it's not entirely trivial to identify and fix this problem. It's just a few hours worth of trouble I won't ever get back, which is also why  I created this PR. It also makes for a not very good first impression.

I agree with your analysis/sentiments mostly.  The thing is, I am really unsure if this class is really a toy class not intended for any serious use or not. Personally I took the stance that this class might have been useful to get something up and running quickly, but it's probably not a good idea in a production environment. But of course, if you're a mysql user it's definitely not going to be quick, you're actually just going to be wasting your time. So I do not think this PR is a good idea; the best real solution is probably to rename the field.
A reasonable compromise might be to make it simpler to change the field names.
